meanings.definition: To decide or announce that a planned event will not take place.
meanings.sent1: The school trip was canceled due to bad weather.
meanings.sent2: She canceled her appointment at the last minute.
meanings.sent3: The magician canceled his disappearing act, much to the audience's disappointment.
meanings.sent4: The storm canceled all hopes of a sunny picnic.
meanings.sent5: The canceled flight left passengers stranded at the airport.

meanings.definition: To mark or draw lines through something to show that it is no longer valid or correct.
meanings.sent1: He canceled the wrong answer on his test paper.
meanings.sent2: The librarian canceled the overdue book from the system.
meanings.sent3: The chef canceled the expired ingredients from the menu.
meanings.sent4: The artist canceled out the mistake with a bold stroke of paint.
meanings.sent5: The teacher canceled the incorrect equation on the whiteboard.
